utterance.speaker: Host
utterance.content: Welcome everybody, welcome to Amazing Discoveries!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, oh! It's on again!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You guys, can we please not watch this all right.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Shhhh!

utterance.speaker: Host
utterance.content: Folks, has this ever happened to you. You go to the refrigerator to get a nice glass of milk, and these darn cartons are so flingin'-flangin' hard to open.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, you said it Mike. Aw! There's got to be a better way!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: And there is Kevin.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Can we please turn this off?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Noo way, Kevin.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: There is a revolutionary new product that guarantees that you'll never have to open up milk cartons again. Meet the Milk Master 2000.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you intrigued?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You're flingin'-flangin' right I am!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Keep in mind, he's never used this product before, you're gonna see how easy this is to do. Go ahead. This works with any milk carton.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow, it is easy. Now, I can have milk everyday.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, it's official there are no good movies.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Well, let's go to a bad one and make out.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Perhaps, you would like me to turn like this, so that you can bunny bump against my back.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, man. What's up?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe you can tell me. My agent would like to know why I didn't show up at the audition I didn't know I had today. The first good thing she gets me in weeks. How could you not give me the message?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I'll tell ya I do enjoy guilt, but, ah, it wasn't me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, it was! It was him! Uh huh! Okay, it was me!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How is it you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, it was just, it was all so crazy, you know. I mean, Chandler was in the closet, counting to 10, and he was up to 7 and I hadn't found a place to hide yet. I-I-I meant to tell you, and I wrote it all down on my hand. See, all of it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yep, that's my audition.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: See, now this is why I keep notepads everywhere.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yep, and that's why we don't invite you to play.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: What is the great tragedy here? You go get yourself another appointment.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, Estelle tried, you know. The casting director told her that I missed my chance.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That is unfair. I'll call her and tell her it was totally my fault.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs, you can't do that. The casting director doesn't talk to friends, she only talks to agents.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What a sad little life she must lead. Okay, ooh .

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What, what are you doing? What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no, no, I know, I know, ooh. 'Hi, this is Katelynn, from Phoebe Buffay's office. Um, is um, Ann there for Phoebe, she'll know what it's about.'

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hang up, hang up.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 'Annie! Hi. Listen we got a problem with Joey Tribbiani, apparently he missed his audition. Who did you speak to in my office? Estelle, no, I don't know what I'm going to do with her. No. All right, so your husband leaves and burns down the apartment, the world does not stop.'

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is anybody else scared?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 'Right, well look, um, if Joey loses this audition, that is it for Estelle. I don't care! Annie you are a doll, what time can you see him?' I need a pen.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Get the woman a pad! Get the woman a pad! A pad! A pad!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, now you want a pad.

utterance.speaker: Carol and Susan
utterance.content: Hey!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: There's my boy! Here's my boy! And here's his Barbi What's ah, what's my boy doing with a Barbi?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: He picked it out of the toy store himself, he loves it.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: He carries it everywhere, it's like a security blanket, but with ski boots and a kicky beret.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, it's, it's, it's cute. Why, why, why does he have it, again?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: So he's got a doll? So what? Unless you're afraid he's gonna grow up and be in show business.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: This doesn't have anything to do with the fact that he is being raised by two women, does it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know what it's fine. If you're okay with the Barbi thing, so am I.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Give daddy the Barbi! Ben, give, give me the Barbi. Okay, how 'bout, don't you want to play with the monster truck? No. Okay, oh, oh, how about a Dino-soilder?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, you are so pathetic. Why can't your son just play with his doll?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I gotta go to work. Has anybody seen my left boob?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I love that movie.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: There it is. Joey, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm sorry, it just felt nice.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joe. Joe! Answer the phone.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I only got one good arm, you know. You should be doing stuff for me. Go get me a sweater.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Just do it! Okay, it's Janice and if I get it I'm going to have to see her tonight. Oh, that's great I'm gonna have to see her tonight.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What's the big deal? Why don't you wanna see Janice?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, last night at dinner, when the meals came, she put half her chicken piccata on my plate and took my tomatoes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And that's bad because..., you hate chicken piccata?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Noo.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You didn't want to share your tomatoes, tomatoes are very important to you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, it's like all of the sudden, we were this couple. And this alarm started going off in my head: 'Run for your life! Get out of the building!'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Men are unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What is it with you people! I mean, the minute you start to feel something, you have to run away?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know, that, that's why I don't want to go tonight, I'm afraid I'm going to say something stupid.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, you mean like that guy thing where you act mean and distant until you get us to break up with you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, you know about that?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look what do I do? I wanna get past this, I don't wanna be afraid of the commitment thing. I wanna go through the tunnel, to the other side!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Where there is no fear of commitment.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do we have any... Do we have any thoughts here?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I've never been through the tunnel myself, 'cause as I understand it, you're not allowed to go through with more than one girl in the car, right. But, it seems to me it's pretty much like anything else, you know, face your fear. It have a fear of heights, you go to the top of the building! If you're afraid of bugs.....get a bug. Right. In this case, you have a fear of commitment, so I say you go in there and be the most committed guy there ever was.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Amazingly, that makes sense.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You think?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Go for it man, jump off the high dive, stare down the barrel of the gun, pee into the wind!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, Joe, I assure you if I'm staring down the barrel of a gun, I'm pretty much peeing every which way.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, it's your audition from this morning. Can I use the phone again?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sure Pheebs, you know, that's what it's there for, emergencies and pretend agents.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on baby, come on!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 'Hi, I have Phoebe Buffay returning a page. Okay, well, um, she's in her car I'll have to patch you through.'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Very nice touch.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 'Okay, go ahead.' Um, hi Annie. Fantastic! You got it. Oh, okay, um, 'Will he work for scale?' you ask me. Well, I don't know about that, except that I do and he will. Great, oh you are such a sweetheart. I would love to have lunch with you, how about we have lunch next.... Op, went through a tunnel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thank you so much.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It was really fun, I mean I've never talked on a car phone before.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You were amazing, could you just do me this huge favor, you see there's this one other audition that I really, really want, and Estelle couldn't get me in.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I don't know. I mean it was fun one time.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on, please, it'll be just this one more, well actually it's two.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Two?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Well, well really it's three. Please. You're so good at it. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I'll do it, but just these three, right

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nooo, four.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: So, how come you wanted to eat in tonight?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: 'Cause, I wanted to uh, give you this.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Ohhh, are you a puppy! Contact paper! I never really know what to say when someone you're sleeping with gives you contact paper.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, wait there's, there's more. See the contact paper is to go into your brand new drawer. See, the drawer actually goes in my dresser.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh, you didn't have to do this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, I did. Yes, I did. Because, you're my girlfriend, and that's what girlfriends should, should get.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Well, I gotta buy a vowel. Because, oh my Gawd! Who, would've thought that someday, Chandler Bing would buy me a drawer.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, not me. But that's what's happened, and, ah, and, and there's more. We should take a trip.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: We should?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yep, we're a couple and that's what couples do. And, I wanna meet your parents. We should take a trip with your parents!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I don't think we need to, because you're tripping me out right now! Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am, I actually am. I mean this is amazing. My entire life I have feared this place, and now that I'm here it's like what was the big deal. I could probably say 'Let's move in together.' and I'd be okay.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: You probably want us to move in together?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It doesn't scare me!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it scares me! I mean I not even divorced yet, Chandler. You know, you just invited me over here for pasta, and all of the sudden you're talking about moving in together. And, and I wasn't even that hungry. You know what, it's getting a little late, and I-I should just, um...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no, don't go! I've scared ya'! I've said too much! I'm hopeless, and awkward, and desperate for love!! Hey, Janice! It's me. Um, yeah, I-I-I just wanna apologize in advance for having chased you down the street.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, this will help.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, I finally catch up to her and she says this relationship is going to fast and we have to slow down.

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Monica
utterance.content: Uff.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That is never good.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Then I got all needy and clingy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, wait a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute. Maybe it's not so bad. How did you leave it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She said she'd call me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Monica
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Welcome to our side of the tunnel.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This ice cream tastes like crap by the way.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, well that's that lo-cal, non dairy, soy milk junk. We sort of, we save the real stuff for those really terminal cases.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You know, when you start get screwed over all the time, you gotta switch to low-fat.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, you do.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, you don't think I'm terminal?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, no, not at all, you're not terminal, you just, you just need some damage control.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, okay. So, should I call her?

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Monica
utterance.content: Nooo!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This is a very critical time right now. If you feel yourself reaching for that phone, then you go shoe shopping, you get your butt in a bubble bath. You want her back you have to start acting aloof.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She has to know that your not ready.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right. So, what you have to do is, you have to accidentally run into her on purpose. And then act aloof.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So I'm not, not gonna lose her?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oooh, honey, you're not a total loser.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I said, 'So I'm not gonna lose her?'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Guess who's here. It's the toughest guy in toy land, Ben. 'A real American hero. I'm G.I. Joe!' Drop the Barbi, drop the Barbi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: G. I. Joe! Cool! Can I play?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look Ben, it's a toy that protects U.S. oil interests overseas!

utterance.speaker: Joey and Ross
utterance.content: Go Joe!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Helloo! Oh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs! There you are!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No it's not, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But Phoebe, wait! Wait! Phoebe. Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, Joey! Oh, okay, see I didn't recognize you wearing, in those....pants.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look listen, that TV movie I went in for? Did you hear anything? I think I got a shot at it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes! They called and you didn't get it! Okay, I mean you didn't get it, I'm sorry, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It's okay, these things happen.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But they shouldn't happen, you know what, you're, you're in a terrible, terrible business. Oh God, I don't wanna be the person who makes your face look like that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I'm, I'm okay. See.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, now you're sad and creepy, oh. You know what, I, I'm sorry I quit, okay, I just quit.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! No, no you can't quit! You're the best agent I ever had! Look Pheebs, rejection is part being an actor, you can't take it personally.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Not personal, really, well they said that they never met an Italian actor with a worse Italian accent.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: They actually said that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Ooh God, there's that face again! See I can't do this job! I...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no, see that's why you have to do this job, agents always lie. You know, Estelle just says stuff like 'They went another way', but this, I can use this. I canna work on a new accent.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah okay, no if it helps you okay. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You'll never get me, Joe!!!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: No, thank you. Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello, Janice.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, just a bit of shopping. How've you been?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Are you being British?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No. Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Why are you shopping here? You don't live in this neighborhood. Were you here waiting for me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, huh. I'm just uh, you know I'm just picking up some things for a party.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Barley? What kind of party serves barley?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I'm sorry if my friends aren't as sophisticated as yours.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Where is this party?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Here in Chelsea.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Who's party is it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: A woman's

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: What woman?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Chelsea.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Okay, you know, one of two things is happening here. Either you're seeing somebody behind my back, which would make you the biggest jerk on the planet. Or, else you're pretending that you're seeing somebody, which just makes you so pathetic that I could start crying right here in the cereal aisle. So like which of these two guys do you want to be?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Can I be that guy?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, so we got some more good rejections, lots of stuff to work on.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, shoot.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, um, oh, the zoo commercial.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I didn't get it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. They said you 'Weren't believable as a human being.' So, you can work on that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, what else?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Um, the off-Broadway play people said 'You were pretty but dumb.'

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no wait, I'm sorry, that's 'pretty dumb.'

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, it's okay, no, no, no, really, look um, I really appreciate this Pheebs, but I think I'm gonna have to go back to Estelle.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, well don't get me wrong, you're a better agent than she is, but at least with her I don't want to blow my pretty dumb brains out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, no, I understand.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You do, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait a minute.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait a minute, did you just make up all that stuff just to get out of being my agent.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, you caught me. I am so busted.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That's-ah what I suspected-ah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ....And then I just, you know, threw the bag of barley at her, and ran out of the store.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My God! Chandler, we said be 'aloof' not 'a doof'.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I've actually ruined this haven't I? It's time for the good ice cream now, right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, it is.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You know what, everything's gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello. Hi, Janice! Can you hold on for a second? Okay. Okay, what do I do?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Shhh...I don't know what to do, this is totally unprecedented.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: If-if-if we ever did what you did a man would never call.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh wait, you know what, I got it, I got it, pretend like you just woke up, okay, that will throw her off. Be sleepy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, and grumpy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you, stop naming dwarves! Hello, Janice. Hi, I'm so glad that you called, I know I've been acting a really weird lately. And, it's just because I'm crazy about you, and I just got...stupid, and, and scared, and....stupid a couple of more times. I'm sorry. Really?! Really?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He's soo lucky, if Janice were a guy, she'd be sleeping with somebody else by now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I love you too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Aw, it's soo unfair.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, I don't know what to tell you guys that's the doll he chose.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: What'd you do, dip it in sugar?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, G. I. Joe's in, Barbi's out. And if you guys can't deal with it, that's your 'too bad.'

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you being such a weenie for? So he has a Barbi, big deal. You used to dress up like a woman.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, you used to dress up in Mom's clothes all the time.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The big hat, the pearls, the little pick handbag.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, you are totally making this up.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How can you not remember? You made us call you...Bea.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I've literally never been this happy.

utterance.content: Wasn't there a little song?

utterance.content: Oh please God, let there be a song.

utterance.content: There was no song. There was no song!

utterance.content: 'I am Bea.'

utterance.content: Okay.
